text: Which of the following answers lists an example order of volatility for a typical computer system?

answers.text: Memory dump, disk files, temporary files, archival media
Archival media, disk files, temporary files, memory dump
Memory dump, temporary files, disk files, archival media
Temporary files, memory dump, archival media, disk files

text: An exact copy of the entire state of a computer system is called:
In forensic analysis, taking hashes ensures that the collected evidence retains:

Log analysis should not take into account the difference between the reading of a system clock and standard time as this impedes the reconstruction of the sequence of events during an attack or security breach.
Which of the following acronyms refers to any type of information pertaining to an individual that can be used to uniquely identify that person?
A sticky note with a password kept on sight in user's cubicle would be a violation of which of the following policies?
Which of the following security controls is used to prevent tailgating?
Zero-day attack exploits:

answers.text: Vulnerability that is present in already released software but unknown to the software developer

text: A system combining heating, ventilating, and air conditioning controls is known as:
EMI shielding protects the transferred data from: (Select all that apply)
Setting up hot and cold aisles in a server room allows for more efficient management of air flow.
Which of the following answers list(s) example(s) of physical security control types? (Select all that apply)
Which of the following examples falls into the category of deterrent security control types?
Which of the following solutions add(s) redundancy in areas identified as single points of failure? (Select all that apply)
What is the goal of tabletop exercises? (Select all that apply)
Hardware-based RAID Level 0: (Select 2 answers)

answers.text: Requires at least three drives to implement
Requires at least two drives to implement

text: Which of the following solutions does not offer fault tolerance?
Which of the following answers lists an example method for passive test of security controls?
Hardware-based RAID Level 1: (Select 3 answers)

answers.text: Requires at least 2 drives to implement
Is also known as disk striping
Offers improved performance in comparison to RAID 0
Offers improved reliability by creating identical data sets on each drive (failure of one drive does not destroy the array as each drive contains identical copy of the data)
Is also referred to as disk mirroring

text: Hardware-based RAID Level 5: (Select 2 answers)

answers.text: Continues to operate in case of failure of more than 1 drive
Requires at least 3 drives to implement
Offers increased performance and fault tolerance (single drive failure does not destroy the array and lost data can be re-created from the remaining drives)
Requires at least 5 drives to implement
Is also referred to as disk duplexing

text: What is the function of archive bit?

answers.text: Creating an additional copy of a file
Indicating whether a file has been modified since the last backup

text: Which of the following terms refers to a backup technique that allows for creating an exact copy of an entire drive and replicating the drive to a new computer or to another drive on the same computer in case of hard drive failure? (Select best answer)
In a differential backup strategy, restoring data from backup requires only a working copy of the last full backup.
Restoring data from an incremental backup requires: (Select 2 answers)

answers.text: Copy of the last incremental backup
All copies of differential backups made since the last full backup
Copy of the last differential backup
All copies of incremental backups made since the last full backup
Copy of the last full backup

text: A United States federal government initiative aimed at enabling agencies to continue their essential functions across a broad spectrum of emergencies is known as:
